info.title: OpenAPI Plant Store
info.description: A sample API that uses a plant store as an example to demonstrate features in the OpenAPI specification

get.summary: Get the LinkedIn profile of the user
get.description: Get the LinkedIn profile of the user. Required at least one of the query parameters

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn profile (optional)

parameters.name: publicIdentifier
parameters.description: Public identifier of the LinkedIn profile (optional)

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: ID of the LinkedIn profile (optional)

parameters.name: main
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to return only main version of the profile that you can see on LinkedIn without expanding profile sections - up to 5 experiences, 2 educations, 2 skills, etc. This version charges less credits

parameters.name: findEmail
parameters.description: Include this parameter to find the email of the profile. It will perform SMTP verifications to ensure deliverability. It will also output emails for catch-all domains and mark them as `risky` (deliverability is unknown). This version charges more credits.

parameters.name: skipSmtp
parameters.description: Include this parameter together with `findEmail` to skip SMTP email verification when finding emails. It will output all possible generated emails without checking deliverability via SMTP. It will do only minimal validations, as checking domains for MX records. This version charges less credits when using with `findEmail`.

parameters.name: includeAboutProfile
parameters.description: Include this parameter to scrape the "About this profile" popup from LinkedIn profiles.

get.description: Search LinkedIn profiles by name, company, location, and more

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search profiles by name

parameters.name: currentCompany
parameters.description: Filter by company ID or Company URL. One value or multiple comma-separated

parameters.name: pastCompany
parameters.description: Filter by past company ID or Company URL. One value or multiple comma-separated

parameters.name: school
parameters.description: Filter by school ID or School URL. One value or multiple comma-separated

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Filter by first name

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Filter by last name

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter by title

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Filter by location text

parameters.name: geoId
parameters.description: Filter by location as LinkedIn Geo ID. Overrides the location query param. Use the /linkedin/geo-id-search endpoint to find the Geo ID

parameters.name: industryId
parameters.description: Filter by industry ID. One value or multiple comma-separated

parameters.name: keywordsCompany
parameters.description: Filter by keywords in company name

parameters.name: keywordsSchool
parameters.description: Filter by keywords in school name

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number, use for pagination

get.description: Get the LinkedIn company. Required at least one of the query parameters

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn company (optional)

parameters.name: universalName
parameters.description: Universal name of the LinkedIn company profile, can be found in URL (optional)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Company name. It will use LinkedIn search and return the most relevant result.

get.description: Retrieve a list of LinkedIn companies matching the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keywords to search for in company names.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Filter companies by location.

parameters.name: geoId
parameters.description: Filter by location as LinkedIn Geo ID. Overrides the location query param. Use the /linkedin/geo-id-search endpoint to find the Geo ID

parameters.name: companySize
parameters.description: Filter by company size. One value or multiple comma-separated. Supported values: '1-10', '11-50', '51-200', '201-500', '501-1000', '1001-5000', '5001-10000', '10001+'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination.

200.description: A list of companies matching the search criteria.

get.description: Get the LinkedIn job details by job ID or URL.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: ID of the LinkedIn job (optional)

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn job (optional)

get.description: Search LinkedIn jobs by title, company, location, and more.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search jobs by title

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Filter by company ID. One value or multiple comma-separated.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Filter by location text

parameters.name: geoId
parameters.description: Filter by location as LinkedIn Geo ID. Overrides the location query param. Use the /linkedin/geo-id-search endpoint to find the Geo ID

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by field. Supported values: 'relevance', 'date'

parameters.name: workplaceType
parameters.description: Filter by workplace type. One or multiple values comma-separated. Supported values: 'office', 'hybrid', 'remote'

parameters.name: employmentType
parameters.description: Filter by employment type. One or multiple values comma-separated. Supported values: 'full-time', 'part-time', 'contract', 'temporary', 'internship'

parameters.name: salary
parameters.description: Filter by salary range. Supported values: '40k+', '60k+', '80k+', '100k+', '120k+', '140k+', '160k+', '180k+', '200k+'

parameters.name: postedLimit
parameters.description: Filter posts by maximum posted date. Supported values: '24h', 'week', 'month'

parameters.name: experienceLevel
parameters.description: Filter by experience level. One or multiple values comma-separated. Supported values: 'internship', 'entry', 'associate', 'mid-senior', 'director', 'executive'

parameters.name: industryId
parameters.description: Filter by industry ID. One value or multiple comma-separated industry IDs. Full list of IDs: https://github.com/HarvestAPI/linkedin-industry-codes-v2/blob/main/linkedin_industry_code_v2_all_eng.csv

parameters.name: functionId
parameters.description: Filter by job function ID. One value or multiple comma-separated function IDs. Full list of IDs: https://github.com/HarvestAPI/apify-linkedin-profile-search/blob/main/.actor/input_schema.json#L142

parameters.name: under10Applicants
parameters.description: Include this parameter to filter jobs with under 10 applicants

parameters.name: easyApply
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' filter jobs with Easy Apply option or 'false' to exclude. Values can be 'true' or 'false'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

get.description: Search LinkedIn Geo ID by location text

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Location text to search for Geo ID (required)

get.description: Get LinkedIn post details by post URL.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn post (required)

get.description: Search LinkedIn posts by keywords, author, date range, and more.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keywords to search for in posts

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: Filter posts by author's profile URL (comma-separated). Note: LinkedIn returns fewer results per profile when using post search. To extract all posts by a profile, use the /linkedin/profile-posts endpoint

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Filter posts by author's profile ID or IDs (comma-separated). It's faster to search by ID. Note: LinkedIn returns fewer results per profile when using post search. To extract all posts by a profile, use the /linkedin/profile-posts endpoint

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Filter posts by this company URL or URLs (comma-separated). Note: LinkedIn returns fewer results per company when using post search. To extract all posts by a company, use the /linkedin/company-posts endpoint

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Filter posts by company ID or IDs (comma-separated). It's faster to search by ID. Note: LinkedIn returns fewer results per company when using post search. To extract all posts by a company, use the /linkedin/company-posts endpoint

parameters.name: authorsCompany
parameters.description: List of LinkedIn companies where authors of posts work (comma-separated)

parameters.name: authorsCompanyId
parameters.description: List of LinkedIn company IDs where authors of posts work (comma-separated)

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Group LinkedIn URL or Group ID

parameters.name: postedLimit
parameters.description: Filter posts by maximum posted date. Supported values: '24h', 'week', 'month'

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by field. Supported values: 'relevance', 'date'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required if it was returned by the previous page. Otherwise the page will always be 1 (on LinkedIn side). Doesn't apply for all queries, usually profile posts return this token

get.description: Get comments of LinkedIn post by post URL.

parameters.name: post
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn post (required)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort comments by field. Supported values: 'relevance', 'date'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination. Default is 1

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required only if sortBy is 'relevance' and page > 1. Use this token from the previous page response.

get.description: Get reactions of LinkedIn post by post URL.

parameters.name: post
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn post (required)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination. Default is 1

get.description: Get comments of LinkedIn profile by post URL.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn profile

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID of the LinkedIn profile. It's faster to search by ID

parameters.name: postedLimit
parameters.description: Filter posts by maximum posted date. Supported values: '24h', 'week', 'month'

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination. Default is 1

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required for pages > 1. Use this token from the previous page response.

get.description: Get reactions of LinkedIn profile by profile URL.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn profile

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Profile ID of the LinkedIn profile. It's faster to search by ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination. Default is 1

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required for pages > 1. Use this token from the previous page response.

get.description: Get LinkedIn profile posts by profile URL, ID, or public identifier.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: Filter posts by author's profile URL

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: Filter posts by author's profile ID. It's faster to search by ID

parameters.name: profilePublicIdentifier
parameters.description: Filter posts by author's profile public identifier (last part in the URL).

parameters.name: postedLimit
parameters.description:
Filter posts by maximum posted date. Supported values: '24h', 'week', 'month'. 
Since LinkedIn doesn't offer a way to filter by date, the filtering will be done on our side, due to that the pagination might have incorrect values, because pagination is returned by LinkedIn without applying the postedLimit filter

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required if it was returned by the previous page. Otherwise the page will always be 1 (on LinkedIn side). Doesn't apply for all queries, usually profile posts return this token

get.description: Get LinkedIn company posts by company URL, ID, or universal name.

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: Filter posts by this company URL

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Filter posts by company ID. It's faster to search by ID

parameters.name: companyUniversalName
parameters.description: Filter posts by company universal name (last part in the URL)

parameters.name: postedLimit
parameters.description:
Filter posts by maximum posted date. Supported values: '24h', 'week', 'month'. 
Since LinkedIn doesn't offer a way to filter by date, the filtering will be done on our side, due to that the pagination might have incorrect values, because pagination is returned by LinkedIn without applying the postedLimit filter

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination

parameters.name: paginationToken
parameters.description: Required if it was returned by the previous page. Otherwise the page will always be 1 (on LinkedIn side). Doesn't apply for all queries, usually profile posts return this token

get.description: Get the LinkedIn group. Required at least one of the query parameters

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the LinkedIn group (optional)

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: ID of the LinkedIn group (optional)

get.description: Retrieve a list of LinkedIn Groups matching the specified search criteria.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keywords to search for.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination.

200.description: A list of groups matching the search criteria.

get.description: Search LinkedIn profile services by name keywords and location.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search profiles by name

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Filter by location text

parameters.name: geoId
parameters.description: Filter by location as LinkedIn Geo ID. Overrides the location query param. Use the /linkedin/geo-id-search endpoint to find the Geo ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number, use for pagination

id.description: The unique identifier for the reaction.

postId.description: The ID of the post that was reacted to.

id.description: The unique identifier for the actor.

linkedinUrl.description: The LinkedIn profile URL of the actor.

position.description: The current position of the actor.
position.example: Student at Yashwantrao Mohite College of Arts, Science and Commerce, Pune

pictureUrl.description: The URL of the actor's profile picture.

width.description: The width of the picture in pixels.

height.description: The height of the picture in pixels.

expiresAt.description: The expiration timestamp of the picture URL in milliseconds since epoch.

id.description: The unique identifier for the comment.

linkedinUrl.description: The direct URL to the comment on LinkedIn.

commentary.description: The text content of the comment.

createdAt.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp of when the comment was created.

numComments.description: The number of replies to this comment.

numShares.description: The number of times this comment has been shared (often null for comments).

numImpressions.description: The number of impressions for this comment (often null).

reactionTypeCounts.description: A list of reaction types and their counts for this comment.

count.description: The number of this type of reaction.

postId.description: The ID of the post to which this comment belongs.

id.description: The unique identifier for the actor who made the comment.

linkedinUrl.description: The LinkedIn profile URL of the actor.

position.description: The current position or headline of the actor.
position.example: Business Analyst | Data-Driven Decision Maker | 5+ Years of Experience in Municipal Data Systems & Public Sector Projects | Passionate About Driving Innovation in Local Governance | Always Exploring New Technologies

pictureUrl.description: The URL of the actor's profile picture.

width.description: The width of the picture in pixels.

height.description: The height of the picture in pixels.

expiresAt.description: The expiration timestamp of the picture URL in milliseconds since epoch.

author.description: Indicates if the actor is the original author of the parent post.

createdAtTimestamp.description: The timestamp of when the comment was created, in milliseconds since epoch.

pinned.description: Indicates if the comment is pinned.

contributed.description: Indicates if the actor is a contributor to the content (e.g., a group admin or page role).

edited.description: Indicates if the comment has been edited.

id.description: Unique identifier for the LinkedIn group.

memberCount.description: Number of members in the group.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp when the logo URL expires.

url.description: URL of the group's hero image.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp when the hero image URL expires.

heroImage.description: Details about the group's hero image.

date.description: Creation date of the group in string format.

timestamp.description: Creation date of the group as a Unix timestamp.

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp and date of the group.

groupPlusStatusActive.description: Indicates if Group Plus status is active.

postApprovalEnabled.description: Indicates if post approval is enabled for the group.

invitationLevel.description: Level of invitation required for the group (e.g., 'Anyone', 'ByInvitation').

automatedWelcomeNoteEnabled.description: Indicates if automated welcome note is enabled.

publicVisibility.description: Indicates if the group is publicly visible.

text.description: Text representation of administrators (e.g., "John Doe and 2 others").

id.description: Unique identifier for the admin profile.

linkedinUrl.description: URL of the admin's LinkedIn profile.

headline.description: Headline of the admin's LinkedIn profile.

picture.description: URL of the admin's profile picture.

id.description: Unique identifier for the LinkedIn group.

members.description: Text representation of the member count (e.g., '10,000+ members').

summary.description: Short summary or description of the group.

picture.description: URL of the group's profile picture.

value.description: Value associated with the action (e.g., a URL or action ID).

primaryActions.description: List of primary actions related to the group.
